issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body:
[mmunn:~]euca-version
euca2ools 3.0.0-alpha6-13-gd70b0fc (Sparta)
[mmunn:~]

[mmunn:~]rpm -qa | grep python-requestbuilder
python-requestbuilder-0.1.0-0.9.alpha9.20130501git0a010ad.fc18.noarch

[mmunn:~]rpm -qa | grep python-progressbar
python-progressbar-2.3-0.0.1.fc18.noarch

Looks like you're hitting a python bug:  http://bugs.python.org/issue6669

http://bugs.python.org/issue6669 addresses the "type" of error thrown not the underlying cause which appears to be a bad gzip file?
see; http://bugs.python.org/issue6669  which is the latest patch for issue6669.

I tried several of the eustore images and they all throw the same error?

Ugh, I copypasted the wrong link and now I can't seem to find the right one any more.  Sorry.  :-\

If I recall correctly, python's gzip module can have problems with files that have incorrect padding that some other tools ignore.  I'll poke around at this a bit more when I finish TOOLS-196.  If anyone else feels like working on this in the mean time, feel free to take this bug.
This issue only seems to happen if eustore-install-image is run remotely from the clc? If I run this on the clc it works?

Well, that's strange.  I just tried to reproduce this bug with a testing build from today and failed, both on the CLC and off it.

Are you able to reproduce the problem on any other machine, perchance?
No,  I just tried to do that today . I am only able to reproduce this on my laptop running Euca2ools 3 and fedora 18 -> QA machines. This may in fact be an issue local to my laptop.
Shall we resolve this for now until someone manages to reproduce it elsewhere?
I am closing this a not a bug. I have it working on my local box after un-installing/re-installing  python and euca2ools on my laptop
